item.title: Can you have a variable in a variable?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Pwnd:

[quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=2747.msg27193#msg27193 date=1147265780]
Yeah, it's method(int... arg), after the parameter type.

Can you do that with enum arguments or object type?[/quote]
Absolutely, every primitive and object type that can be passed to a method as a parameter is supported by varargs. varargs basically leave the option open to pass several variable values instead of just one without having to pass it in array form - just like an array, you can have as many (or as little, even zero) values/elements as you like. Therefore type is not limited.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you have a variable in a variable?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

not what she means bro, i am fairly confident that she is implying a variable inside a variable without making a class for it, hence enumerations like having an array of values N[] and also have N an integer at the same time....

Enumerations > RS2 Cheating lol

EDIT: You might want to look into Varargs :-p, I can do this public int method(int arg..);

and i'm able to call it with either of the following
method(54);
method(intarray1);

splendiferous.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you have a variable in a variable?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

here is something ive been having alittle problem with im probly just trying to do it harder than it really is but lets say in a void i have

int N = token3[0];

N = the int variable

now in another void i have

tNc = true;

i want it so it can be t1c t2c t3c ect...

is their any way of doing this? or am i just going about it in a very hard manner

if this can not be done is thier anything easier than

if (n == 1){
t1c = true;
}else {
if (n ==2){
t2c = true;
}
